constituent: face up, person, stamp album, box, stamps
heisigStory: This character is used both for lying on one's back faceup, and for looking up to someone with respect and awe. Its elements: person . . . box . . . stamps.
koohiiStory1: Mr T with the post package at the post office: ´these stamps don´t stick to the box, foo´ Postguy:´ Try it again but this time with the stamp, face-up.´.
koohiiStory2: Mr. T, his "acting career" in its twilight, must now FACE-UP to the fact that his mug will never appear on a BOX of cereal or on a STAMP.
kunYomi: あお.ぐ、おお.せ、お.っしゃる、おっしゃ.る
readingExamples: 仰視 (ぎょうし), 仰天 (ぎょうてん), 仰角 (ぎょうかく), 仰ぐ (あお.ぐ), 仰せ (おお.せ)
words: to look up (to), to respect, to depend on, to ask for, to seek, to revere, to drink, to take
to say, to speak, to tell, to talk
